pros: Very strong team based environment.
cons: None that I can note.

pros: Salary is not competitive. I held the same position at another UHS hospital and was paid 10K more.
cons: Units are severely understaffed. Not enough MHTs and/or LPNs/RNs on unit. Safety can be a concern both between patients and staff/patients.

pros: The ground staff were really nice
cons: Management doesn’t care. Forced to do things in retaliation. Filed a complaint with corporate to just be told they don’t care

job_title: Mental Health Technician in New Philadelphia, PA
pros: all the overtime you can possibly want,eat for free,and you get to meet alot of people and learn a lot from them if your truly in it for more than a paycheck.i loved it thier
cons: most of the nurses will not protect you and they will disrespect the patients and staff. HR will ignore you and the way the corporate side of the hospital is unfair so all though i love the job i hated parts of it

review_title: It's too bad, because this hospital was once great.
pros: I loved the MHT and nursing staff at Friends - however they are all overworked and understaffed (despite what administration says.) Many staff are really showing up for the patients daily, even with little support or compensation.
cons: UHS is a nightmare company, and egregious in the lack of support they give their on-the-floor staff. Friends Hospital unfortunately follows suit, and the administration is woefully disconnected from what is happening in the day-to-day on the units. They are completely out of touch and are the primary reason that good staff leave. There is little to no support, even when specifically asked. The administration also has a history of downplaying the understaffing at the hospital, which creates regular safety concerns - as well as an inability for the staff to provide care and best practice to the patients.

review_title: Good pay, not supportive higher ups.
pros: Good pay, easy to understand the work, great co workers
cons: Not supportive boss, stuck in the 1920s when it comes to paperwork

review_title: Good place for Social Workers seeking discharge planning experience
pros: Good pay, Diversity and Inclusion
cons: No supervision, limited support from management or coworker, aggressive clients, long work hours, no room for growth

pros: Staff community, there were always shifts available to pick up
cons: There were so many available shifts because the staffing was always low during pandemic. Bad staff retention. Bad HR management

pros: I love working with the mental health population

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Unlimited overtime it’s always hours available if you need to pick up extra
cons: Not enough pay if the pay was more I would love it it’s a good job over all

job_title: F R I E N D S (R N) in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Competitive salary; reasonable benefits, accommodating, positive, professional, sufficient training for an experienced staff, modern medication management.
cons: Ancillary staff are often untrained, have a desire to 'muscle' patients, need on-going training in a therapeutic approach, need better and more objective supervision from administrative staff. Too many friendships between administrative staff and ancillary staff. Causes spitting and friction between professional staff and ancillary staff. Support of unprofessional behavior. Many ancillary staff do not have the ability to remain objective.Often leads to ethical conflict on patient treatment. Often do not take responsibility for own actions that lead to conflict and impulsive reactions to patients.

pros: If you are good at what you do, Friends takes good care of you to ensure you keep up the good work. Overtime is almost always readily available, pay and benefits are excellent. Most importantly, the majority of people who work there are in it for the right reasons - to care for those who are suffering and to help them on their road to recovery.
cons: Since it appears the majority of their funding stream comes from public assistance for individuals, it APPEARS that the insurance company who oversees behavioral healthcare in Philadelphia has too great of an influence. A lot of time seems to be spent chasing tails to keep CBH and OMH happy, and the patients sometimes seem to get lost somewhere in the middle.

pros: Wide range of clientele to work with and dedicated coworkers on the team. Ability to learn from various disciplines and doctors working together on the treatment team.
cons: Limited ability for advancement in the company and minimal increase in salary year to year. Very high stress levels on a daily basis.

pros: Slim to no pros working for this company.
cons: Management is disorganized. Leaders to not take into account the staff and do not mind to overwork their current employees. Will not fix the issues with understaffing.
